intro: Clidemia dasytricha, commonly known as Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and coastal habitats. Clidemia dasytricha plays a role in local ecosystems but can also be invasive in certain areas.
